abstract: James B. Lee Jr., one of JPMorgan Chase’s top rainmakers, told CNBC that the signs are emerging that mergers activity should rebound this year.
snippet: James B. Lee Jr., one of JPMorgan Chase’s top rainmakers, told CNBC that the signs are emerging that mergers activity should rebound this year.
lead_paragraph: Few people are as plugged into Wall Street’s deal machine than James B. Lee Jr., the JPMorgan Chase vice chairman known as the money man of mergers and acquisitions.
